{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3649801,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-09T21:38:49.277Z","cooked":"

Has anyone mounted their MaxSwerve modules in non-typical fashion above the frame or other possible configurations? I was thinking about potential to do that to lower the robot ground clearance. But would be interested to see how any other team might have went about doing so.

Did you use additional 2x1 tubing above the rails? Extra long bolts? Spacers? Or other ways. And did you experience any issues?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-06-09T21:38:49.277Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":266,"readers_count":265,"score":123.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":502978,"topic_slug":"mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame","display_username":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":2695,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame/502978/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3649820,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-09T22:17:41.484Z","cooked":"

Last season we dropped our belly pan 2" to do this. I believe the initial plan was just a smaller 2"x1" tube along the full edge, which was eventually sectioned out to save weight, so we had smaller chunks of tube in more strategic locations.

We did the same thing. Basically, we built a normal chassis and then attached slightly shorter tubes to the bottom:

img_12591920×1440 333 KB

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-06-09T23:06:36.181Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":160.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502978,"topic_slug":"mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44763,"username":"tekdemo","name":"Dan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":6}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame/502978/3","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":6}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":6,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3649857,"name":"Paul Regnier","username":"Paul_R","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/paul_r/{size}/203827_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-10T00:01:29.093Z","cooked":"

We did this as well with 2 layers of 1x2 tubes, but with a bellypan between both layers. This allowed us to mount electronics in both an upside-down (“brainpan”) configuration and upwards like a traditional bellypan layout, giving us way more space. It also let us have basically no hround clearance which was helpful for not tipping or getting stuck on top of game pieces, although it would probably not work in any game with some kind of raised element on the field (ex 2018 climb platform, 2020 bars).

Are the bottom rails only fastened by the rivets on each side of the polycarb plate? How well did that hold up?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-06-10T01:51:30.018Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":172,"readers_count":171,"score":54.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502978,"topic_slug":"mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame","display_username":"Christoforus Cedric Kurniawan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64857,"username":"pigrammer","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63122,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame/502978/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3649922,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-10T02:14:26.580Z","cooked":"

No, there were other things holding them together, primarily these gussets:

image1423×666 84.2 KB

image1321×768 89.5 KB

(apologize for the poor image quality, I have to look through old photos as Woodpecker (this robot) is sadly no longer together)
If I remember correctly, some of the features on the siderails like the bumper mounts and camera mounts utilized through bolts which also helped hold the tubes together. You may be able to see more on this picture (please don’t judge the state of the robot, this is after it completely fell apart and we did a repair in a few hours for an offseason competition):
image1281×960 197 KB

Overall it held up pretty well. The only failures in the frame rails were rivets ripping out of the thin side of the MAXTube (not related to this, but you can see it in the photo) and the intake tube bending during an impact (the intake side only had the upper tube and not the lower one, so not related to this + we think it would have been better had it been not MAXTube or at least MAXTube without the scribe lines). You can see both another gusset holding things together on the left and the bent intake rail on the right in this photo:
image1920×2560 403 KB

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-06-10T02:14:26.580Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":159,"readers_count":158,"score":81.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":502978,"topic_slug":"mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":63122,"username":"Cedric_2587","name":"Christoforus Cedric Kurniawan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cedric_2587/{size}/255741_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/mounting-maxswerve-above-the-frame/502978/6","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3650427,"name":"Kendree C","username":"kchenturtles","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kchenturtles/{size}/200823_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-10T19:02:44.260Z","cooked":"

Well…gussets alone wouldn’t have been enough to hold the top and bottom layers of 2x1 together (they’re not particularly strong against bending in that direction) and with just gussets the chassis would have “rubix cubed” a bit after corner impacts. IIRC we put four through bolts in between the tubes on each side, having drilled clearance holes so that we were just bolting the two inside touching layers together, and that held up for the whole season without issues, but it was primarily those bolts that were keeping the chassis together.
